ingredients.item: 200g savoy cabbage (½ small cabbage), trimmed and shredded
3 tbsp mayonnaise (ideally in a squeezy bottle)
1 tbsp Cooks’ Ingredients aonori seaweed flakes
4 salad onions, trimmed and finely sliced

instructions.step: In a large jug or mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, eggs and 225-250ml water until you have a smooth, thin batter; season. Mix in the cabbage and kimchi.

Put 1 tbsp oil in a small non-stick frying pan (about 20cm) over a medium heat. Ladle in ½ the batter and let it fry for 6-7 minutes, until golden-brown underneath and just set. Quickly and confidently flip the pancake over and cook for a further 4-5 minutes.

Meanwhile, mix together the sugar, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce and soy sauce until smooth. When the pancake is cooked, brush ½ this glaze over the top. Transfer to a plate, drizzle with ½ the mayonnaise and sprinkle over ½ the seaweed, sesame seeds, ginger and salad onions. Repeat with the remaining batter, glaze and toppings. Serve the pancakes straight away.
